sentences: Jaime Mendoza-Nava (December 1, 1925 – May 31, 2005) was a Bolivian-American composer and conductor.
Mendoza-Nava was born in La Paz, Bolivia.
He won the Madrid Conservatory's First Prize in 1950, completing the five-year program in a year's time.
Mendoza-Nava’s grandson, Nic Mendoza (born April 4, 1989), is a music and multimedia producer.
"La niña que toca el arpa" (piano and soprano singer)
